intro: Lepidosperma elatius var. ensiforme, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mat-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves that form dense, low-growing mats. It typically grows in wet or seasonally wet habitats such as swamps, marshes, and along waterways. The inflorescence consists of spikelets that are clustered at the base of the plant, producing small, inconspicuous flowers.
